text: Remove the packaging from the chicken.  Place the chicken in a seasoned pan of boiling water. Cook away for about 25 minutes. Turn down the heat to a simmer. You need to do this to get all the flavour from the chicken bones. When chicken meat comes off the carcass, remove the carcass and any remaining bones. Remember to leave the pieces of chicken in the seasoned full of flavour water. This is your base for the soup. In a frying pan, melt the butter. Add the salt, peppers, sliced onions, sliced mixed peppers, mushrooms and fry until soft. Add the soya sauce and sweetcorn and stir.  Add cubes of cooked ham and stir, combining and fusing together all the flavours.  Back to the chicken and stock base, add the rice and pasta shells, the chicken gravy granules, vegetable stock cube. Stir and simmer. Add the ingredients from the frying pan to the stock and simmer. Cook away to infuse flavours. It is best to leave soup in pot removed from heat to infuse flavour overnight. Reheat and serve with crusty bread the following day. Enjoy!
